result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Jonathan Hynek

records.addlTxt: Received call from defs wife regarding atty fee. Clerk approved for November payment to be made online 11-4-2022. kef

8:50 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Andrew Jonathan Hynek in court.  Attorney Timothy Dale Anderson in court for Andrew Jonathan Hynek.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews files.  Atty Anderson here for the 22CM410- Branch III file and Atty Dolfi is attorney on record for 22CM23- Branch II. Atty Anderson asks for these matters to be in one Branch if there's an agreement. If a Global Resolution is made the cases will trail in one Branch.  Court schedules this matter for one more hearing to see what status the other file is at.  DE is on PO hold for a different matter. Bond continues in form and amount. Adjourned at 8:56 AM. bph

records.addlTxt:
9:41 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Andrew Jonathan Hynek in court, in custody.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Andrew Jonathan Hynek.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Dolfi states she will follow up on status of representation.  ADA Smestad states there was an offer sent to defense.  Atty Dolfi has received the offer but still needs time to negotiate.  DE on PO hold.  Adjourned at 9:43 AM. bph
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 18, 2022 at 08:45 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Alexa H.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:17 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA: Michelle Brekken with Student Intern Alison Casey DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson for today Defendant Andrew Jonathan Hynek in court. Victim appeared. Atty Dolfi represents DE on underlying matter. Atty Harrelson states DE needs to provide additional information before a final determination can be made if DE qualifies for PD.  DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. NG. Reserve on pre-plea rights. PO Hold. Bond argument. Court addresses victim; bond ordered. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned at 1:22 PM.  gll
